channel.title: Comments on: SQL Server: Starting a Server-Side Trace
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: Great post Jes. Welcome to team LTD. Remember, you aren't allowed to retire until you get to 250 posts.
item.content:encoded: Great post Jes. Welcome to team LTD. Remember, you aren’t allowed to retire until you get to 250 posts.

item.title: By: Jeremy Rothman-Shore
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Rothman-Shore
item.content:encoded:
Can you provide more details on the benefits of running it server-side versus through the profiler? You say “The problem is that this graphical tool, especially when run from a workstation, can place a heavy load on the server.”

From the “graphical tool” side, that part will be taken by the workstation, so I don’t see why it would place more stress on the server.

Is it the overhead of shipping it out to the workstation? Wouldn’t the overhead of sending it to network storage be the same issue?
